alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Gilmer (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 2:27PM EDT until May 08 at 7:30AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in West Virginia... Little Kanawha River At Glenville affecting Gilmer and Calhoun Counties. For the Little Kanawha River...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Kanawha River At Glenville. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Water reaches the hotel foundation on South Court Street next to the old bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 26.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:45 PM EDT Saturday was 26.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.6 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.7 feet on 08/09/1958. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 230 AM EDT.
